intro: Ischarum haenseleri, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in its harsh environment. Ischarum haenseleri is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
